page.title: 17The Canonbie By-pass
page.content: Before June 1984 the A7 trunk route from Carlisle to Edinburgh ran through the middle of Canonbie village and crossed two bridges on the way north to Langholm. In 1982 Balfour-Beatty began work on a by-pass to the West of the village. It took them two years to build and it cost Â£7 million. The by-pass is 4.65 miles long. It was very noisy and dirty living near it while it was being built so it was a relief when it was opened in 1984. Mr E. Armstrong a local councillor opened the by-pass and the pupils of Canonbie school were invited to the opening. Mark Little of the school presented the scissors to Mr Armstrong to cut the tape. Traffic through the village has been cut down a lot but the traffic on the by-pass drives at speeds well over the legal speed limit.
